revised_title: Raman Spectra of Gaseous and Liquid Neopentane: Intensity Ratios of Totally Symmetrical Vibrations
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the Raman spectra of gaseous and liquid neopentane. They determined the relative intensities of the totally symmetrical vibrations in the gas and found that Wolkenstein's bond polarizability theory is a good approximation for the modes considered. The results were compared with previous measurements of liquid neopentane, showing a general agreement.
